bug.short_desc: python2-bashate - requires both python2 and python3

long_desc.thetext:
Hi, there is a issue with the spec:
%install %py2_install
%if 0%{with_python3} %py3_install %endif
And then in both packages: %{_bindir}/%{pypi_name}
This mean you are including in the python2 subpackage a executable than requires the python3 version of this package, you must update your spec to something like:
%install %py2_install mv %buildroot/%{_bindir}/%{pypi_name} %buildroot/%{_bindir}/%{pypi_name}-py2
and then in the python2 subpackage %{_bindir}/%{pypi_name}-py2
See: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Packaging:Python#Avoiding_collisions_between_the_python_2_and_python_3_stacks
Updated to 0.5.1, I fixed the symlinks, now default binary is python3 version.
